id.description: Unique ID for the step (e.g., uuid)

criteria.description: Use RuleCondition from automation or duplicate if strictly decoupled

module_id.description: The module this workflow applies to

actor_id.description: User ID who performed the action

record_id.description: The ID of the record being modified

models.CronJob.description: Cron job configuration for scheduled automation

actions.description: Actions to execute (reusing automation action types)

conditions.description: Conditions to filter records (optional, for record-based jobs)

description.example: Send daily reminder for uncontacted leads

module_id.description: Optional module to target for record-based operations

schedule.description: Cron expression (e.g., "0 0 * * *" for daily at midnight)

models.CronJobLog.description: Execution log for a cron job

models.EscalationRule.description: Rule for automatic ticket escalation based on conditions

description.example: Escalate high priority tickets with no response after 30 minutes

operator.description: eq, ne, gt, lt, gte, lte, contains, in, etc.

lookup_label.description: Target Field to display in UI (e.g. name)

fields.description: Fields to include from this module

lookup_field.description: Field in base module that references this module

column_fields.description: Fields to group by for columns

row_fields.description: Fields to group by for rows

columns.description: List of field names to display

module_id.description: The module this report is based on

models.SLAPolicy.description: SLA policy defining response and resolution time limits

models.StatusHistoryEntry.description: History entry for ticket status changes

models.Ticket.description: Customer support ticket with multi-channel support, SLA tracking, and escalation

description.example: Customer is experiencing login issues with their account

models.TicketComment.description: Comment or internal note on a support ticket

content.example: Customer has been contacted via email
